page.title: 02Geology of Boughton
page.content: Our block is situated on the north- east slopes of the North Downs.It is an area showing typical traditional Kent farming.From the higher ground there is a wonderful panaramic view of the salt marsh coast,the Swale Estuary and the Isle of Harty (part of Sheppey). The land is a mix of Solid and Drift geology.The soil types flow from north to south throughout the block.From east to west there is Brickearth, Thanet Beds surrounding Oldhaven Beds and Alluvium in the central valley. Moving up towards the hills there is another strip of Thanet Beds, Oldhaven Beds and finally London Clay. The latter often slumps after heavy rain or major roadworks etc..We have found a relationship between soil types and crops,details of which can be found on page three.
